channel.title: Living on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in Living on ZooBerry

item.title: Asiatic Cheetah
item.description: An endangered cheetah from Asia with no description provided.

item.title: Aye-Aye
item.description: A unique animal coded by Penguinman and skinned by Electric Eel. ES recommended for optimal performance.

item.title: Baringo Giraffe (ES Version)
item.description: The tallest animal in the world, created for the Endangered Species pack.

item.title: Bezoar Goat
item.description: The wild ancestor of domestic goats, created for base Zoo Tycoon 2.

item.title: Bezoar Goat (ES Version)
item.description: The wild ancestor of domestic goats, created for Endangered Species pack.

item.title: Black and White Ruffed Lemur
item.description: Black and White Ruffed Lemur with two skin variants and original sounds.

item.title: Living
item.description: Animals that still roam the Earth today.

item.title: Bobcat
item.description: A boreal cat native to North America.

item.title: Brown Koala
item.description: A recolor of the original koala. This is not a skin but a new animal.

item.title: Camargue Wild Horse
item.description: A European wetlands horse living in semi-wild conditions in the swampy areas of southern France.

item.title: Cameroon Dwarf Goat (ES Version)
item.description: Pygmy goats originally came from West Africa. Includes 100% Endangered Species design with new skin, sound, food, and enrichment.

item.title: Cameroon Dwarf Goat
item.description: Pygmy goats originally came from the Cameroon region of West Africa but are now found as pets in many places.

item.title: Caracal
item.description: A very cute little Caracal created entirely by Exitree.

item.title: Caribbean Flamingo (ES Version)
item.description: The Caribbean flamingos are brightest, showing their true colors of red, pink, or orange on their legs, bills, and faces. Includes 100% Endangered Species design.

item.title: Chinstrap Penguin
item.description: This penguin lives in the sub-Antarctic islands. Coded by Penguinman with skins by Electric Eel.

item.title: Caribbean Flamingo
item.description: The brightest Caribbean flamingos, showing true red, pink, or orange colors on their legs, bills, and faces.

item.title: Dama Gazelle (ES Version)
item.description: The ES version of one of the gazelles in the Gazelle Pack by SilesianTomcat.

item.title: Domestic Donkey
item.description: Domestic Donkey

item.title: Domestic Donkey (ES Version)
item.description: Domestic Donkey: 100% Endangered Species design. Includes new skin, sound, food, and enrichment.

item.title: European Beaver
item.description: European Beaver (Eurasian Beaver), the first animal created by Panda11.

item.title: Fallow Deer
item.description: Here is the Fallow Deer. It is coded by Penguinman and beautifully recolored by Exitree. I hope you enjoy this European animal!

item.title: Eurasian Wolf
item.description: The Eurasian Wolf features two variants, with the lighter one as the default.

item.title: Lemon Shark
item.description: The Lemon Shark features two variations, with the darker variation as the default skin. Requires MM2 to use.

item.title: Spotted Hyena II
item.description: The Spotted Hyena requires the Endangered Species and African Adventure expansions to use.

item.title: King Cheetah
item.description: A unique cheetah variant with elongated and merged spots.

item.title: King Penguin
item.description: A large penguin species with fixed alphabetical issues and fame stars in the mod.

item.title: Kodiak Bear
item.description: The Kodiak bear is a recolored grizzly bear adapted to tundra environments.

item.title: Red Ruffed Lemur
item.description: The red ruffed lemur is one of the largest primates of Madagascar, with thick red and black fur.

item.title: Rhea
item.description: A large, flightless bird of South America with new skin, sound, and enrichment.

item.title: Forest Elephant
item.description: A species of elephant native to African rainforests.

item.title: Forest Elephant (ES Version)
item.description: A species of elephant native to African rainforests, featuring new enrichment and sound.

item.title: Golden Dart Frog
item.description: The Golden Dart Frog is a bright yellow tropical amphibian, native to rainforests.

item.title: Himalayan Monal
item.description: An alpine-dwelling bird with vibrant plumage, native to the Himalayas.

item.title: Iberian Wolf
item.description: The Iberian wolf (Canis lupus signatus) is a critically endangered wolf native to Portugal and Spain.

item.title: Klipspringer
item.description: An antelope that bounds from rock to rock.

item.title: Norwegian Fjord Pony
item.description: A domesticated pony, one of the oldest horse breeds known to mankind.

item.title: Endless Ocean: Luminous
item.description: A pack containing a plethora of aquatic animals created by Buffzoo, majorgalah, and gamevideosforlife.

item.title: Nilgiri Tahr
item.description: Nilgiri Tahr is an animal for Zoo Tycoon 2 created by Austroraptor.

item.title: Three-Toed Sloth
item.description: Three-Toed Sloth is an animal for Zoo Tycoon 2 created by Hendrix and Unicorn.

item.title: Yellow Mongoose II
item.description: Yellow Mongoose is an animal for Zoo Tycoon 2 created by Gerben.

item.title: Boer Goat
item.description: Boer Goat is an animal for Zoo Tycoon 2 created by Slice.

item.title: Sloth Bear II
item.description: Sloth Bear is an animal for Zoo Tycoon 2 created by Gerben.

item.title: Red River Hog
item.description: The Red River Hog is a species of wild pig native to Africa.

item.title: Prairie Dog
item.description: A small rodent that lives in the prairies of North America.

item.title: Patas Monkey
item.description: The Patas Monkey is a ground-dwelling monkey distributed over semi-arid areas of West Africa, and into East Africa.

item.title: Malayan Sun Bear
item.description: The Malayan Sun Bear is a small bear species that lives in the tropical forests of Southeast Asia.

item.title: Impala
item.description: The Impala is a small antelope that lives in the savannahs of Africa.

item.title: Grant's Zebra
item.description: This is a Grant’s Zebra mod for Zoo Tycoon 2, created by DutchDesigns.

item.title: Giant Eland II
item.description: The Giant Eland is a large antelope species native to the savannas of Africa.

item.title: Dwarf Mongoose
item.description: A small, social mongoose species native to Africa. Mod by DutchDesigns.

item.title: Diana Monkey
item.description: The Diana Monkey (Cercopithecus diana) is an Old World monkey found in West Africa.

item.title: Lesser Mouse Deer
item.description: A Lesser Mouse Deer made by Longisquama.

item.title: Congo Buffalo
item.description: A Congo Buffalo made by Tom.

item.title: Blesbok
item.description: A blesbok made by Gerben and Jannick.

item.title: Zebra Duiker
item.description: Zebra Duiker made by Longisquama.

item.title: African Leopard
item.description: African Leopard made by Mayer and Ludozoo.

item.title: Owston's Palm Civet
item.description: An Owston’s palm civet by Hendrix.

item.title: Indian Rhinoceros III
item.description: The Indian Rhinoceros (Rhinoceros unicornis), also called Greater one-horned rhinoceros, can be found in parts of north-eastern India and in protected areas in the Terai of Nepal.

item.title: Giant Anteater II
item.description: A giant anteater by Hendrix and German13.

item.title: Emperor Tamarin
item.description: The Emperor Tamarin (Saguinus imperator) is a tamarin allegedly named for its resemblance to the German emperor Wilhelm II.

item.title: Roosevelt Elk
item.description: A Roosevelt Elk made by ShenTirag in 2006; originally released on Shen’s Den.

item.title: Aardwolf
item.description: Aardwolves occur solely on the continent of Africa. There are two separate populations.

item.title: Asian Small-Clawed Otter
item.description: The Asian Small-Clawed Otter is a wetlands mammal. It is smaller than the Sea Otter.

item.title: Atlantic Sailfish
item.description: The Atlantic Sailfish is uber amazing: It’s also AWESOME and POINTY! (quote from ShenTirag)

item.title: Australian Spotted Jellyfish
item.description: This large and spectacular jellyfish is common during the summer months in New South Wales coastal waters and estuaries, including Sydney Harbour.

item.title: Black-Backed Jackal
item.description: These animals are omnivorous and will eat carrion, as well as plants such as grass, fruit, berries and seed.

item.title: Cannonball Jellyfish
item.description: The cannonball jellyfish, also known as the cabbagehead jellyfish, is a species of jellyfish in the family Stomolophidae.

item.title: Chinese Alligator
item.description: The Chinese alligator is a crocodilian endemic to China.

item.title: Cross Jellyfish
item.description: This jelly is commonly seen in Monterey Bay during spring and summer, sometimes in large groups.

item.title: Deepwater Trachymedusa
item.description: Benthocodon pedunculata is found in deep water habitats like Monterey Canyon and San Clemente Basin on the West Coast.

item.title: Dhole II
item.description: The dhole is a species of canid native to Southeast Asia. It is the only extant member of the genus Cuon.

item.title: Dik-Dik
item.description: The coat of Kirk’s dik-dik is an overall grizzled grey-brown to reddish brown, while the head and legs are tawny in colour.

item.title: Dingo
item.description: The dingo is an Australian wild dog living in various habitats, ranging from tropical coastal beaches, inland deserts or alpine forest.

item.title: Dwarf Cassowary
item.description: Casuarius bennetti is found on the island of New Guinea. The majority of the population resides in Papua New Guinea, on the eastern side of the island.

item.title: Exmoor Pony
item.description: The Exmoor Pony is a hardy, sturdy breed of semi-feral pony, one of many of the mountain and moorland ponies of the British Isles.

item.title: Flower Hat Jellyfish
item.description: This striking and rare jelly has brilliant, multicolored tentacles trailing from a translucent, pinstriped bell.

item.title: Fried Egg Jellyfish
item.description: This jellyfish resembles a fried egg when seen from above.

item.title: Granrojo
item.description: In photographs, it looks like a big red spaceship cruising the ocean depths.

item.title: Gray's Monitor
item.description: Gray’s monitor gets its common name from its previous scientific name of Varanus grayi.

item.title: Greater Kudu
item.description: This is the Greater Kudu, the second largest antelope in Africa.

item.title: Jackson's Mongoose
item.description: Jackson’s mongooses are typically a greyish or dull brownish in color, with the legs being black.

item.title: Leopard Tortoise
item.description: Leopard tortoises have a huge range, being found on the savannahs of Africa from the Sudan South to the Cape Province of South Africa.

item.title: Lion's Mane Jellyfish
item.description: The lion’s mane jellyfish can be found in the cooler regions of the Atlantic, Pacific, North Sea and Baltic.

item.title: Maned Wolf
item.description: A South American savannah-dwelling canid with one variant skin.

item.title: Mauve Stinger
item.description: This species of jellyfish, commonly known as mauve stinger, is widely distributed in all warm and temperate waters.

item.title: Purple-Striped Jellyfish
item.description: Of all the gelatinous creatures visiting Monterey Bay, the purple-striped jelly is certainly among the most recognizable and spectacular.

item.title: Red Grouse
item.description: The red grouse is differentiated by its plumage being reddish brown and not having a white winter plumage.

item.title: Red-Footed Tortoise
item.description: Also known as the South American red-footed tortoise, the males grow up to 13.5 inches (30.4 cm) and are somewhat larger than females.

item.title: Yellow-Footed Rock Wallaby
item.description: The yellow-footed rock wallaby is one of the brightest members of the kangaroo family.

item.title: Zorilla
item.description: The zorilla is a skunk-like mammal that lives in African savannas. It is also called the striped polecat.

item.title: American Badger
item.description: A white dorsal stripe extends back over the head from the nose of the American badger.

item.title: Clouded Leopard
item.description: A tropical rainforest cat from Southeast Asia. This amazing tropical rainforest cat is coded by Penguinman and recolored by Exitree. Enjoy!

item.title: Eurasian Badger
item.description: Eurasian badgers are easily recognisable by the conspicuous black and white stripes running from the nose to the shoulders.

item.title: Skunk
item.description: Skunks produce a very smelly spray that repels most predators. This oily, yellow liquid is produced in two glands located under the tail.

item.title: Sorraia
item.description: Sorraia horses are a remnant population of an indigenous, South Iberian wild horse.

item.title: Chamois
item.description: They live in rocky areas and alpine meadows in Europe (especially the Alps, Carpathians) and in Asia minor.

item.title: Eastern Cougar
item.description: Here is the Eastern Cougar. This cat is colored by August and coded by Penguinman! Enjoy!

item.title: Japanese Serow
item.description: A single-horned Asian rhinoceros, coded by Penguinman and skinned by Koala Komander.

item.title: Yellow-Knobbed Curassow
item.description: The yellow-knobbed curassow is a large terrestrial bird that eats fruit.

item.title: Bactrian Camel
item.description: The Bactrian camel is a large even-toed ungulate native to the steppes of eastern Asia.

item.title: Dugong
item.description: The dugong (sometimes refered to as a sea cow) is a mammal- that is, it suckles its young.

item.title: Giant Anteater
item.description: The giant anteater, Myrmecophaga tridactyla, is the largest species of anteater.

item.title: Nubian Ibex
item.description: The Nubian ibex is relatively small compared to other ibexes.

item.title: Asian Golden Cat
item.description: The Asian golden cat is a very mystical looking creature. Many Asian groups also have mystical stories and legends about this cat.

item.title: Lesser Flamingo
item.description: The lesser flamingo is herbivorous, feeding solely on a blue-green algae growing within a very limited range of pH.

item.title: Ornate Box Turtle
item.description: The ornate box turtle is one of two turtle species on the Great Plains that are terrestrial.

item.title: Red Deer
item.description: Red deer have a reddish-brown coat, which changes to a brownish-grey in the winter.

item.title: Slender-horned Gazelle
item.description: The slender-horned gazelle is the palest gazelle species, with a cream or yellow-white coloured body.

item.title: Tibetan Blue Bear
item.description: The Tibetan blue bear is a sub-species of the brown bear found in the eastern Tibetan plateau.

item.title: Amur Leopard
item.description: The Amur leopard is a wild feline predator native to the mountainous areas of the Russian Far East.

item.title: Blue Poison Dart Frog
item.description: These little frogs are easily recognized by their blue color, which is generally darker on the limbs and belly and overlaid with black spots or patches.

item.title: Caribbean Reef Squid
item.description: The Caribbean reef squid is found throughout the Caribbean Sea as well as off the coast of Florida.

item.title: Cassowary
item.description: Cassowaries are very large flightless birds native to the tropical forests of New Guinea and northeastern Australia.

item.title: Mainland Serow
item.description: The serow lives alone or in small groups. It is attached to its territory, which usually covers just a few miles square.

item.title: Red Eyed Tree Frog
item.description: A vibrant tree frog native to Central and South America, known for its bright red eyes.

item.title: Ribbon Eel
item.description: Ribbon eels are aptly named for their delicate movements, as they swim like a slender ribbon dancing in the water column.

item.title: Strawberry Dart Frog
item.description: The strawberry poison dart frog is common in the Atlantic lowland tropical forests of Central America.

item.title: Zebroid
item.description: A zebroid is a cross between a zebra and any other equid: essentially, a zebra hybrid.

item.title: Arctic Fox
item.description: Arctic foxes are pure white in winter and grey-brown in summer. They can also be light brown, grey, chocolate, or black with a bluish hue.

item.title: Spotted Hyena
item.description: Spotted hyenas are the largest member of the family Hyaenidae. This family also includes three other hyena species.

item.title: Wisent
item.description: This ungulate is also known as the European bison. Some authors consider it and the American bison to be conspecific.

item.title: Bat Eared Fox
item.description: These foxes live in the scrub, savannah and grasslands of Africa.

item.title: Black Bear
item.description: The North American black bear is the best known and most widespread of the North American bears.

item.title: Bonobo
item.description: Bonobos live in the forests located centrally in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (formerly Zaire).

item.title: Bornean Pygmy Elephant
item.description: Borneo pygmy elephants have significantly different characteristics from their cousins found on mainland Asia and Sumatra.

item.title: Chacoan Peccary
item.description: The Chacoan peccary’s bristly coat is a speckled charcoal or brownish-grey, interspersed with long guard hairs.

item.title: Common Dolphin
item.description: Common dolphins can be found throughout the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

item.title: Crocodile Monitor
item.description: Generally arboreal, or tree dwelling. Crocodile monitors inhabit rainforests and adjacent savannas.

item.title: Fire-bellied Toad
item.description: Despite the remarkably vivid coloring of its underbelly, the Oriental fire-bellied toad merges perfectly with its surroundings.

item.title: Nile Monitor Lizard
item.description: The Nile monitor is distributed across most of Africa, except the northwest.

item.title: Red Fox II
item.description: Red foxes are native to the Nearctic, Palearctic, Oriental, and Ethiopian regions, and have been introduced to areas in the Australian region.

item.title: Sloth Bear
item.description: Sloth bears live in the tropical rainforest of India.

item.title: Yacare Caiman
item.description: The yacare caiman is found in a variety of habitat types, often associated with floating mats of vegetation.

item.title: Red Fox
item.description: The most widespread carnivore in the world is ready for your zoos!

item.title: European Badger
item.description: European Badger skinned and coded by ShenTirag, with the model created by SilesianTomcat.

item.title: Bream
item.description: A freshwater fish from various types of waterways in Europe.

item.title: Domesticated Silver Fox (Siberian Fox)
item.description: A domesticated form of the silver morph of the red fox.

item.title: Yellow Stingray
item.description: A small reef-dwelling stingray.

item.title: Koi Carp
item.description: A domesticated cyprinid known for their wide range of color morphs.

item.title: Tiger Shark
item.description: A species of requiem shark and the only member of the genus Galeocerdo.

item.title: Puma/Cougar
item.description: A large American cat that goes by many other names.

item.title: Indian Hyena
item.description: A population of hyena from India.

item.title: Red Wolf
item.description: A wolf made by Radar and koala komander.

item.title: Fringe Eared Oryx
item.description: The Fringe-Eared Oryx is a scrub dwelling antelope. It is a subspecies of gemsbok native to southern Africa.

item.title: Goral
item.description: The Goral is an Asian Antelope

item.title: Yellow Mongoose
item.description: An African mongoose. Its main biome is scrub. Will not dig under chain link fences!

item.title: Waterbuck
item.description: Here’s a waterbuck for your zoo.

item.title: Wallaroo
item.description: It is one star, main biome is scrub, but it also likes alpine.

item.title: Spanish Broom Hare
item.description: A plant and animal both from northern Spain.

item.title: Narrow-Striped Mongoose
item.description: A bushy-tailed mongoose from the dry forests of Madagascar.

item.title: Pygmy Goat
item.description: The Pygmy Goat is a grassland animal that all of the guests love.

item.title: Nutria
item.description: A large rodent!

item.title: Atlantic Devil Ray
item.description: This animal had been translated by Nique!

item.title: Dall Sheep
item.description: First animal Ive ever made

item.title: Dhole
item.description: Resized bigger than the wolf

item.title: Fanaloka
item.description: New and improved, with 4 different skins and a new model for both adult and baby!

item.title: Giant Eland
item.description: The Largest Species of Antelope - Now Available to Adopt in Your Zoo! Comes with 3 Variant Skins!

item.title: Himalayan Tahr
item.description: A large goat from the Himalayas.

item.title: Indian Rhinoceros I
item.description: An Indian rhino for your zoo. Recolored from the Javan rhino.

item.title: Indian Rhinoceros II
item.description: A large, endangered species of rhino from Northern India.

item.title: Iriomote Cat
item.description: The Iriomote cat, an endangered species from Japan.

item.title: Italian Wolf
item.description: A subspecies of wolf from the Apennine Mountains in Italy.

item.title: Long-Tailed Weasel
item.description: This is a North American weasel for ZT2. It contains 2 variants (not shown) - white and brown with light facial markings.

item.title: Mexican Wolf
item.description: The Mexican Wolf is a sub-species of the Gray Wolf.

item.title: Miniature Pony
item.description: A miniature pony! for your zoo! =D

item.title: American Flamingo
item.description: The American flamingo lives in the Coastal Biome.

item.title: Ankole Cow
item.description: An African Cow for your zoos!

item.title: Brown Pelican
item.description: A large, colourful Pelican found in South and Central America. Has 2 varients, biome is Reef.

item.title: Kiang
item.description: This Asian equid lives in the desert biome, and is a light sandy colour.

item.title: Pine Marten
item.description: A small boreal forest mustelid.
